intro: Galium haenkeanum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing herbaceous perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, linear to lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium haenkeanum is native to temperate regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
